channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China cuts benchmark lending rates by 25 basis points
item.description: The move was expected. China's central bank governor indicated last week that the loan prime rates would be lowered.

item.title: Iran aided Russia against Ukraine. Now it needs to call in the favor
item.description: Iran could do with assistance from its powerful ally, Russia. The extent to which Moscow can — and will — help is uncertain, however.

item.title: Boeing machinists to vote on new proposal with 35% raises that could end strike
item.description: The IAM will vote Wednesday on the new proposal which includes 35% wage increases over four years, a higher signing bonus of $7,000 and more.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Who’s watching Netflix shares? Everyone
item.description: Many of us like to watch Netflix shows. With the company’s dominance in the media and streaming space, Netflix’s stock, too, is worth watching.

item.title: ‘They want something different’: Two reports predict a big shift in travel behavior in 2025
item.description: Trend reports from Expedia and Booking.com show vacationers are forgoing splashy trips to global hot spots in favor of lesser-known places.

item.title: How Liberty Media became one of the world's most valuable sports empires
item.description: As global lockdowns began in 2020, sports fans surged online and Liberty Media had a chance to realize Chairman John Malone's vision.

item.title: Here's why inflation may look like it's easing but is still a huge problem
item.description: By nearly every barometer, inflation is still well above where most Americans, and in fact some Fed officials, feel comfortable.

item.title: Perplexity AI seeks valuation of about $9 billion in new funding round
item.description: Perplexity started the year with a roughly $500 million valuation and has continued attracting significant investor interest alongside the generative AI boom.

item.title: China needs stimulus with 'beautiful deleveraging' to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio
item.description: China must employ a “beautiful deleveraging” in addition to its recent stimulus measures in order to avoid debt crisis, says Ray Dalio.

item.title: D.E. Shaw, Mantle Ridge zero in on key fixes to build shareholder value at Air Products
item.description: Both activists want to address CEO succession planning and capital allocation at the company.

item.title: Nvidia, Google, Microsoft and more head to Las Vegas to tout health-care AI tools
item.description: Tech companies are in Las Vegas this week to talk health-care AI at the HLTH conference.

item.title: Crypto's $130 million congressional election binge has candidates like Utah's John Curtis poised for big wins
item.description: In running to take Mitt Romney's Senate seat, Republican John Curtis has benefited by being a friend to the crypto industry.

item.title: Netflix rose 11% after third-quarter earnings beat
item.description: Netflix saw momentum in its ad-supported membership tier, which surged 35% quarter over quarter.

item.title: Stellantis to shutter and sell large testing facility amid cost-cutting efforts
item.description: Stellantis' Arizona Proving Grounds covers 4,000 acres between Phoenix and Las Vegas in Yucca, Arizona.

item.title: U.S. deficit tops $1.8 trillion in 2024 as interest on debt surpasses trillion-dollar mark
item.description: The shortfall was more than 8% from the previous year and the third highest on record, the Treasury Department said Friday.

item.title: Port of Los Angeles freight rail delays reach two-year high, with holiday and everyday items piling up
item.description: Record September imports at the Port of Los Angeles driven by the East Coast strike have led to two-year high cargo congestion at rail yards.

item.title: After a well-received quarter, Cramer explains why he thinks Netflix can 'rock on higher'
item.description: NBC's Jim Cramer explained why the quarter made him more optimistic about Netflix's future.

item.title: Procter & Gamble earnings beat estimates, but weak demand in China hurts sales
item.description: Procter & Gamble said volume fell in its Greater China market despite the earnings beat.

item.title: Germany’s auto giants are struggling to stay relevant
item.description: Germany's automotive sector, long recognized for producing high-quality cars, is struggling to preserve its relevance in the age of electrification.

item.title: BlackRock's ETF chief says 75% of its bitcoin buyers are crypto fans new to Wall Street
item.description: Bitcoin ETF inflows surpass $2.1 billion in a week as bitcoin touches highest price level since July.

item.title: Spirit Airlines extends debt refinancing deadline hours before expiration
item.description: Spirit Airlines on Friday again extended a deadline with its credit card processor to renegotiate more than $1 billion in debt.

item.title: Watch maker Patek Philippe launches first new collection in 25 years
item.description: The new collection comes at a time when luxury watch prices have largely stabilized, fueled by strong demand.

item.title: Amazon cloud boss says employees unhappy with 5-day office mandate can leave
item.description: Amazon's cloud boss on Thursday told employees who are unhappy with the company's new five-day in-office mandate they can leave for other companies.

item.title: Tesla faces NHTSA investigation of ‘Full Self-Driving’ after fatal collision
item.description: Tesla faces a new U.S. probe concerning its "Full Self-Driving" systems, and whether they are safe to use in "reduced roadway visibility conditions."

item.title: After rejecting Google takeover, cyber firm Wiz says it will IPO 'when the stars align'
item.description: Wiz is hoping to achieve $1 billion in annual recurring revenue in 2025 — a key condition the company wants to meet before going public.

item.title: Op-ed: The financial toxicity of cancer is growing. Here's what can be done to reduce it
item.description: For the first time in history, more than two million Americans will receive a new cancer diagnosis in 2024, and that is creating significant financial hardship.

item.title: Why some families will pay $500,000 for Ivy League admissions consulting: 'It’s worth the investment'
item.description: To get a leg up in the competitive world of college admissions, some families are spending half a million dollars or more on private consultants.

item.title: IMF chief warns 'not yet time to celebrate' as low growth and high debt weigh on global economy
item.description: The head of the International Monetary Fund cautioned on Thursday that high government debt and low growth remained major impediments to the global economy.

item.title: Historic bitcoin theft tied to Connecticut kidnapping, luxury cars, $500K bar bills
item.description: The kidnapping of a Connecticut couple has been linked to one of the biggest thefts of cryptocurrency from an individual in United States history.

item.title: Overseas UK territories are the ‘biggest enablers of corporate tax abuse,’ tax advocacy group says
item.description: British overseas territories are the world's top enablers of corporate tax abuse, according to a ranking by tax advocacy group Tax Justice Network.
